description: Returns the description of an endpoint configuration created using the CreateEndpointConfig API.

parameters.name: EndpointConfigName
parameters.description: The name of the endpoint configuration.

nested_items.name: EndpointConfigName
nested_items.description: Name of the SageMaker endpoint configuration.

nested_items.name: EndpointConfigArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the endpoint configuration.

nested_items.name: ProductionVariants
nested_items.description: An array of ProductionVariant objects, one for each model that you want to host at this endpoint.

nested_items.name: VariantName
nested_items.description: The name of the production variant.

nested_items.name: ModelName
nested_items.description: The name of the model that you want to host. This is the name that you specified when creating the model.

nested_items.name: InitialInstanceCount
nested_items.description: Number of instances to launch initially.

nested_items.name: InstanceType
nested_items.description: The ML compute instance type.

nested_items.name: InitialVariantWeight
nested_items.description: Determines initial traffic distribution among all of the models that you specify in the endpoint configuration. The traffic to a production variant is determined by the ratio of the VariantWeight to the sum of all VariantWeight values across all ProductionVariants. If unspecified, it defaults to 1.0.

nested_items.name: AcceleratorType
nested_items.description: This parameter is no longer supported. Elastic Inference (EI) is no longer available.

nested_items.name: CoreDumpConfig
nested_items.description: Specifies configuration for a core dump from the model container when the process crashes.

nested_items.name: DestinationS3Uri
nested_items.description: The Amazon S3 bucket to send the core dump to.

nested_items.name: KmsKeyId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Key Management Service (Amazon Web Services KMS) key that SageMaker uses to encrypt the core dump data at rest using Amazon S3 server-side encryption. The KmsKeyId can be any of the following formats:
// KMS Key ID "1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"
// Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a KMS Key "arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"
// KMS Key Alias "alias/ExampleAlias"
// Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a KMS Key Alias "arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:alias/ExampleAlias"

nested_items.name: ServerlessConfig
nested_items.description: The serverless configuration for an endpoint. Specifies a serverless endpoint configuration instead of an instance-based endpoint configuration.

nested_items.name: MemorySizeInMB
nested_items.description: The memory size of your serverless endpoint. Valid values are in 1 GB increments: 1024 MB, 2048 MB, 3072 MB, 4096 MB, 5120 MB, or 6144 MB.

nested_items.name: MaxConcurrency
nested_items.description: The maximum number of concurrent invocations your serverless endpoint can process.

nested_items.name: ProvisionedConcurrency
nested_items.description: The amount of provisioned concurrency to allocate for the serverless endpoint. Should be less than or equal to MaxConcurrency.

nested_items.name: VolumeSizeInGB
nested_items.description: The size, in GB, of the ML storage volume attached to individual inference instance associated with the production variant. Currently only Amazon EBS gp2 storage volumes are supported.

nested_items.name: ModelDataDownloadTimeoutInSeconds
nested_items.description: The timeout value, in seconds, to download and extract the model that you want to host from Amazon S3 to the individual inference instance associated with this production variant.

nested_items.name: ContainerStartupHealthCheckTimeoutInSeconds
nested_items.description: The timeout value, in seconds, for your inference container to pass health check by SageMaker Hosting. For more information about health check, see How Your Container Should Respond to Health Check (Ping) Requests.

nested_items.name: EnableSSMAccess
nested_items.description: You can use this parameter to turn on native Amazon Web Services Systems Manager (SSM) access for a production variant behind an endpoint. By default, SSM access is disabled for all production variants behind an endpoint. You can turn on or turn off SSM access for a production variant behind an existing endpoint by creating a new endpoint configuration and calling UpdateEndpoint.

nested_items.name: ManagedInstanceScaling
nested_items.description: Settings that control the range in the number of instances that the endpoint provisions as it scales up or down to accommodate traffic.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: Indicates whether managed instance scaling is enabled.

nested_items.name: MinInstanceCount
nested_items.description: The minimum number of instances that the endpoint must retain when it scales down to accommodate a decrease in traffic.

nested_items.name: MaxInstanceCount
nested_items.description: The maximum number of instances that the endpoint can provision when it scales up to accommodate an increase in traffic.

nested_items.name: RoutingConfig
nested_items.description: Settings that control how the endpoint routes incoming traffic to the instances that the endpoint hosts.

nested_items.name: RoutingStrategy
nested_items.description: Sets how the endpoint routes incoming traffic:
LEAST_OUTSTANDING_REQUESTS: The endpoint routes requests to the specific instances that have more capacity to process them.
RANDOM: The endpoint routes each request to a randomly chosen instance.

nested_items.name: InferenceAmiVersion
nested_items.description: Specifies an option from a collection of preconfigured Amazon Machine Image (AMI) images. Each image is configured by Amazon Web Services with a set of software and driver versions. Amazon Web Services optimizes these configurations for different machine learning workloads.
Accelerator: GPU.
NVIDIA driver version: 535
CUDA version: 12.2
Accelerator: GPU.
NVIDIA driver version: 535
CUDA version: 12.2
NVIDIA Container Toolkit with disabled CUDA-compat mounting.
Accelerator: GPU.
NVIDIA driver version: 550
CUDA version: 12.4
NVIDIA Container Toolkit with disabled CUDA-compat mounting.
Accelerator: Inferentia2 and Trainium.
Neuron driver version: 2.19

nested_items.name: CapacityReservationConfig
nested_items.description: Settings for the capacity reservation for the compute instances that SageMaker AI reserves for an endpoint.

nested_items.name: CapacityReservationPreference
nested_items.description: Options that you can choose for the capacity reservation. SageMaker AI supports the following options:

nested_items.name: MlReservationArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies the ML capacity reservation that SageMaker AI applies when it deploys the endpoint.

nested_items.name: DataCaptureConfig
nested_items.description: Configuration to control how SageMaker AI captures inference data.

nested_items.name: EnableCapture
nested_items.description: Whether data capture should be enabled or disabled (defaults to enabled).

nested_items.name: InitialSamplingPercentage
nested_items.description: The percentage of requests SageMaker AI will capture. A lower value is recommended for Endpoints with high traffic.

nested_items.name: DestinationS3Uri
nested_items.description: The Amazon S3 location used to capture the data.

nested_items.name: KmsKeyId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Key Management Service key that SageMaker AI uses to encrypt the captured data at rest using Amazon S3 server-side encryption.
Key ARN: arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab.
Alias name: alias/ExampleAlias.
Alias name ARN: arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:alias/ExampleAlias.

nested_items.name: CaptureOptions
nested_items.description: Specifies data Model Monitor will capture. You can configure whether to collect only input, only output, or both.

nested_items.name: CaptureMode
nested_items.description: Specify the boundary of data to capture.

nested_items.name: CaptureContentTypeHeader
nested_items.description: Configuration specifying how to treat different headers. If no headers are specified SageMaker AI will by default base64 encode when capturing the data.

nested_items.name: CsvContentTypes
nested_items.description: The list of all content type headers that Amazon SageMaker AI will treat as CSV and capture accordingly.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: JsonContentTypes
nested_items.description: The list of all content type headers that SageMaker AI will treat as JSON and capture accordingly.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: KmsKeyId
nested_items.description: Amazon Web Services KMS key ID Amazon SageMaker uses to encrypt data when storing it on the ML storage volume attached to the instance.

nested_items.name: CreationTime
nested_items.description: A timestamp that shows when the endpoint configuration was created.

nested_items.name: AsyncInferenceConfig
nested_items.description: Returns the description of an endpoint configuration created using the CreateEndpointConfig API.

nested_items.name: ClientConfig
nested_items.description: Configures the behavior of the client used by SageMaker to interact with the model container during asynchronous inference.

nested_items.name: MaxConcurrentInvocationsPerInstance
nested_items.description: The maximum number of concurrent requests sent by the SageMaker client to the model container. If no value is provided, SageMaker chooses an optimal value.

nested_items.name: OutputConfig
nested_items.description: Specifies the configuration for asynchronous inference invocation outputs.

nested_items.name: KmsKeyId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Key Management Service (Amazon Web Services KMS) key that SageMaker uses to encrypt the asynchronous inference output in Amazon S3.

nested_items.name: S3OutputPath
nested_items.description: The Amazon S3 location to upload inference responses to.

nested_items.name: NotificationConfig
nested_items.description: Specifies the configuration for notifications of inference results for asynchronous inference.

nested_items.name: SuccessTopic
nested_items.description: Amazon SNS topic to post a notification to when inference completes successfully. If no topic is provided, no notification is sent on success.

nested_items.name: ErrorTopic
nested_items.description: Amazon SNS topic to post a notification to when inference fails. If no topic is provided, no notification is sent on failure.

nested_items.name: IncludeInferenceResponseIn
nested_items.description: The Amazon SNS topics where you want the inference response to be included.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: S3FailurePath
nested_items.description: The Amazon S3 location to upload failure inference responses to.

nested_items.name: ExplainerConfig
nested_items.description: The configuration parameters for an explainer.

nested_items.name: ClarifyExplainerConfig
nested_items.description: A member of ExplainerConfig that contains configuration parameters for the SageMaker Clarify explainer.

nested_items.name: EnableExplanations
nested_items.description: A JMESPath boolean expression used to filter which records to explain. Explanations are activated by default. See `EnableExplanations <https://docs.aws.amazon.com/sagemaker/latest/dg/clarify-online-explainability-create-endpoint.html#clarify-online-explainability-create-endpoint-enable>`__for additional information.

nested_items.name: InferenceConfig
nested_items.description: The inference configuration parameter for the model container.

nested_items.name: FeaturesAttribute
nested_items.description: Provides the JMESPath expression to extract the features from a model container input in JSON Lines format. For example, if FeaturesAttribute is the JMESPath expression 'myfeatures', it extracts a list of features [1,2,3] from request data '{"myfeatures":[1,2,3]}'.

nested_items.name: ContentTemplate
nested_items.description: A template string used to format a JSON record into an acceptable model container input. For example, a ContentTemplate string '{"myfeatures":$features}' will format a list of features [1,2,3] into the record string '{"myfeatures":[1,2,3]}'. Required only when the model container input is in JSON Lines format.

nested_items.name: MaxRecordCount
nested_items.description: The maximum number of records in a request that the model container can process when querying the model container for the predictions of a synthetic dataset. A record is a unit of input data that inference can be made on, for example, a single line in CSV data. If MaxRecordCount is 1, the model container expects one record per request. A value of 2 or greater means that the model expects batch requests, which can reduce overhead and speed up the inferencing process. If this parameter is not provided, the explainer will tune the record count per request according to the model container's capacity at runtime.

nested_items.name: MaxPayloadInMB
nested_items.description: The maximum payload size (MB) allowed of a request from the explainer to the model container. Defaults to 6 MB.

nested_items.name: ProbabilityIndex
nested_items.description: A zero-based index used to extract a probability value (score) or list from model container output in CSV format. If this value is not provided, the entire model container output will be treated as a probability value (score) or list.

nested_items.name: LabelIndex
nested_items.description: A zero-based index used to extract a label header or list of label headers from model container output in CSV format.

nested_items.name: ProbabilityAttribute
nested_items.description: A JMESPath expression used to extract the probability (or score) from the model container output if the model container is in JSON Lines format.

nested_items.name: LabelAttribute
nested_items.description: A JMESPath expression used to locate the list of label headers in the model container output.

nested_items.name: LabelHeaders
nested_items.description: For multiclass classification problems, the label headers are the names of the classes. Otherwise, the label header is the name of the predicted label. These are used to help readability for the output of the InvokeEndpoint API. See the response section under Invoke the endpoint in the Developer Guide for more information. If there are no label headers in the model container output, provide them manually using this parameter.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: FeatureHeaders
nested_items.description: The names of the features. If provided, these are included in the endpoint response payload to help readability of the InvokeEndpoint output. See the Response section under Invoke the endpoint in the Developer Guide for more information.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: FeatureTypes
nested_items.description: A list of data types of the features (optional). Applicable only to NLP explainability. If provided, FeatureTypes must have at least one 'text' string (for example, ['text']). If FeatureTypes is not provided, the explainer infers the feature types based on the baseline data. The feature types are included in the endpoint response payload. For additional information see the response section under Invoke the endpoint in the Developer Guide for more information.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ShapConfig
nested_items.description: The configuration for SHAP analysis.

nested_items.name: ShapBaselineConfig
nested_items.description: The configuration for the SHAP baseline of the Kernal SHAP algorithm.

nested_items.name: MimeType
nested_items.description: The MIME type of the baseline data. Choose from 'text/csv' or 'application/jsonlines'. Defaults to 'text/csv'.

nested_items.name: ShapBaseline
nested_items.description: The inline SHAP baseline data in string format. ShapBaseline can have one or multiple records to be used as the baseline dataset. The format of the SHAP baseline file should be the same format as the training dataset. For example, if the training dataset is in CSV format and each record contains four features, and all features are numerical, then the format of the baseline data should also share these characteristics. For natural language processing (NLP) of text columns, the baseline value should be the value used to replace the unit of text specified by the Granularity of the TextConfig parameter. The size limit for ShapBasline is 4 KB. Use the ShapBaselineUri parameter if you want to provide more than 4 KB of baseline data.

nested_items.name: ShapBaselineUri
nested_items.description: The uniform resource identifier (URI) of the S3 bucket where the SHAP baseline file is stored. The format of the SHAP baseline file should be the same format as the format of the training dataset. For example, if the training dataset is in CSV format, and each record in the training dataset has four features, and all features are numerical, then the baseline file should also have this same format. Each record should contain only the features. If you are using a virtual private cloud (VPC), the ShapBaselineUri should be accessible to the VPC. For more information about setting up endpoints with Amazon Virtual Private Cloud, see Give SageMaker access to Resources in your Amazon Virtual Private Cloud.

nested_items.name: NumberOfSamples
nested_items.description: The number of samples to be used for analysis by the Kernal SHAP algorithm.

nested_items.name: UseLogit
nested_items.description: A Boolean toggle to indicate if you want to use the logit function (true) or log-odds units (false) for model predictions. Defaults to false.

nested_items.name: Seed
nested_items.description: The starting value used to initialize the random number generator in the explainer. Provide a value for this parameter to obtain a deterministic SHAP result.

nested_items.name: TextConfig
nested_items.description: A parameter that indicates if text features are treated as text and explanations are provided for individual units of text. Required for natural language processing (NLP) explainability only.

nested_items.name: Language
nested_items.description: Specifies the language of the text features in ISO 639-1 or ISO 639-3 code of a supported language.

nested_items.name: Granularity
nested_items.description: The unit of granularity for the analysis of text features. For example, if the unit is 'token', then each token (like a word in English) of the text is treated as a feature. SHAP values are computed for each unit/feature.

nested_items.name: ShadowProductionVariants
nested_items.description: An array of ProductionVariant objects, one for each model that you want to host at this endpoint in shadow mode with production traffic replicated from the model specified on ProductionVariants.

nested_items.name: VariantName
nested_items.description: The name of the production variant.

nested_items.name: ModelName
nested_items.description: The name of the model that you want to host. This is the name that you specified when creating the model.

nested_items.name: InitialInstanceCount
nested_items.description: Number of instances to launch initially.

nested_items.name: InstanceType
nested_items.description: The ML compute instance type.

nested_items.name: InitialVariantWeight
nested_items.description: Determines initial traffic distribution among all of the models that you specify in the endpoint configuration. The traffic to a production variant is determined by the ratio of the VariantWeight to the sum of all VariantWeight values across all ProductionVariants. If unspecified, it defaults to 1.0.

nested_items.name: AcceleratorType
nested_items.description: This parameter is no longer supported. Elastic Inference (EI) is no longer available.

nested_items.name: CoreDumpConfig
nested_items.description: Specifies configuration for a core dump from the model container when the process crashes.

nested_items.name: DestinationS3Uri
nested_items.description: The Amazon S3 bucket to send the core dump to.

nested_items.name: KmsKeyId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Key Management Service (Amazon Web Services KMS) key that SageMaker uses to encrypt the core dump data at rest using Amazon S3 server-side encryption. The KmsKeyId can be any of the following formats:
// KMS Key ID "1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"
// Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a KMS Key "arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab"
// KMS Key Alias "alias/ExampleAlias"
// Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a KMS Key Alias "arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:alias/ExampleAlias"

nested_items.name: ServerlessConfig
nested_items.description: The serverless configuration for an endpoint. Specifies a serverless endpoint configuration instead of an instance-based endpoint configuration.

nested_items.name: MemorySizeInMB
nested_items.description: The memory size of your serverless endpoint. Valid values are in 1 GB increments: 1024 MB, 2048 MB, 3072 MB, 4096 MB, 5120 MB, or 6144 MB.

nested_items.name: MaxConcurrency
nested_items.description: The maximum number of concurrent invocations your serverless endpoint can process.

nested_items.name: ProvisionedConcurrency
nested_items.description: The amount of provisioned concurrency to allocate for the serverless endpoint. Should be less than or equal to MaxConcurrency.

nested_items.name: VolumeSizeInGB
nested_items.description: The size, in GB, of the ML storage volume attached to individual inference instance associated with the production variant. Currently only Amazon EBS gp2 storage volumes are supported.

nested_items.name: ModelDataDownloadTimeoutInSeconds
nested_items.description: The timeout value, in seconds, to download and extract the model that you want to host from Amazon S3 to the individual inference instance associated with this production variant.

nested_items.name: ContainerStartupHealthCheckTimeoutInSeconds
nested_items.description: The timeout value, in seconds, for your inference container to pass health check by SageMaker Hosting. For more information about health check, see How Your Container Should Respond to Health Check (Ping) Requests.

nested_items.name: EnableSSMAccess
nested_items.description: You can use this parameter to turn on native Amazon Web Services Systems Manager (SSM) access for a production variant behind an endpoint. By default, SSM access is disabled for all production variants behind an endpoint. You can turn on or turn off SSM access for a production variant behind an existing endpoint by creating a new endpoint configuration and calling UpdateEndpoint.

nested_items.name: ManagedInstanceScaling
nested_items.description: Settings that control the range in the number of instances that the endpoint provisions as it scales up or down to accommodate traffic.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: Indicates whether managed instance scaling is enabled.

nested_items.name: MinInstanceCount
nested_items.description: The minimum number of instances that the endpoint must retain when it scales down to accommodate a decrease in traffic.

nested_items.name: MaxInstanceCount
nested_items.description: The maximum number of instances that the endpoint can provision when it scales up to accommodate an increase in traffic.

nested_items.name: RoutingConfig
nested_items.description: Settings that control how the endpoint routes incoming traffic to the instances that the endpoint hosts.

nested_items.name: RoutingStrategy
nested_items.description: Sets how the endpoint routes incoming traffic:
LEAST_OUTSTANDING_REQUESTS: The endpoint routes requests to the specific instances that have more capacity to process them.
RANDOM: The endpoint routes each request to a randomly chosen instance.

nested_items.name: InferenceAmiVersion
nested_items.description: Specifies an option from a collection of preconfigured Amazon Machine Image (AMI) images. Each image is configured by Amazon Web Services with a set of software and driver versions. Amazon Web Services optimizes these configurations for different machine learning workloads.
Accelerator: GPU.
NVIDIA driver version: 535
CUDA version: 12.2
Accelerator: GPU.
NVIDIA driver version: 535
CUDA version: 12.2
NVIDIA Container Toolkit with disabled CUDA-compat mounting.
Accelerator: GPU.
NVIDIA driver version: 550
CUDA version: 12.4
NVIDIA Container Toolkit with disabled CUDA-compat mounting.
Accelerator: Inferentia2 and Trainium.

nested_items.name: CapacityReservationConfig
nested_items.description: Settings for the capacity reservation for the compute instances that SageMaker AI reserves for an endpoint.

nested_items.name: CapacityReservationPreference
nested_items.description: Options that you can choose for the capacity reservation. SageMaker AI supports the following options:

nested_items.name: MlReservationArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that uniquely identifies the ML capacity reservation that SageMaker AI applies when it deploys the endpoint.

nested_items.name: ExecutionRoleArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that you assigned to the endpoint configuration.

nested_items.name: VpcConfig
nested_items.description: Specifies an Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) that your SageMaker jobs, hosted models, and compute resources have access to. You can control access to and from your resources by configuring a VPC. For more information, see Give SageMaker Access to Resources in your Amazon VPC.

nested_items.name: SecurityGroupIds
nested_items.description: The VPC security group IDs, in the form sg-xxxxxxxx. Specify the security groups for the VPC that is specified in the Subnets field.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Subnets
nested_items.description: The ID of the subnets in the VPC to which you want to connect your training job or model. For information about the availability of specific instance types, see Supported Instance Types and Availability Zones.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: EnableNetworkIsolation
nested_items.description: Indicates whether all model containers deployed to the endpoint are isolated. If they are, no inbound or outbound network calls can be made to or from the model containers.
